data.title: Pierce Brosnan's wife Keely shares a heartfelt tribute to the star on his 71st birthday
data.meta_description:
Pierce Brosnan and wife Keely Shаye Brosnan have been married since 2001 - and are stronger than ever. 
On ...
data.text:
Pierce Brosnan and wife Keely Shаye Brosnan have been married since 2001 – and are stronger than ever.

On Friday, Keely, 60, shared a heartfelt and gushing tribute post to her Bond star husband as he celebrated turning 71.

Underneath a flashback photo of the Irish star at the beach, she wrote: "Happy Birthday to the love of my life."

READ MORE: Glen Powell's parents troll him at a screening of Hit Man

"You are my rock, my anchor, my everything… and I love you endlessly," she added.

Last month, the pair marked 30 years since they first met.

The couple, who married back in 2001, gushed about their romance in an Instagram post.

READ MORE: Heartbreaking reason star documented cancer journey

READ MORE: '80s singer Lisa Lisa reveals she had to keep her cancer diagnosis a secret

"4-8-94 was my lucky day. How could I have known as I walked around the corner and into your life that my destiny was about to change forever?" Keely began in her post.

"Thanking my lucky stars that I had the courage to introduce myself to you and forever grateful for the connection and family we share 3 decades later. Happy 30th Anniversary!@piercebrosnanofficial ✨ Time flies on loves wings. "

Brosnan replied: "Thank God for you my dear Keely, you have given me wings to fly. Love you dearly."

For a daily dose of 9Honey, subscribe to our newsletter here

The actor's first wife Cassandra Harris passed away from cancer in 1991, four years after her diagnosis, leaving the actor a single dad of three.

Tragedy would strike again decades later when Brosnan's daughter Charlotte died the same way.

"There is an incredible cruelty in it all, losing a person you shared everything with," the actor told People in a 1992 interview, four months after Cassandra's death. "This is the first time in my life I've ever experienced bereavement, and it's overwhelming.

"She has made me the man I am, the actor I am, the father I am. She's forever embedded in every fibre of my being. She's there with me every day. I was so blessed to have met someone like that."
